message: The door is locked.
You have the impression that Zuul'khan is not dead. He just disappeared into the ground.

You have the impression that Zuul'khan is not dead. He just disappeared into the ground.
You should tell Bogsten about this.
Hmm ... hmm ...
Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.
An empty vessel makes the loudest sound. So they that have the least wit are the greatest babblers.
There are two things a person should never be angry at: What they can help, and what they cannot.
How could they see anything but the shadows if they were never allowed to move their heads?
All is flux, nothing stays still.
Leave me now, kid. I'm trying to think, don't confuse me with your presence.

replies.text: OK. I will come back when you have more time.

message: Oh young kid, you look like someone nice. I don't want you to be injured because of me. I urge you to leave!
No. I shouldn't be telling you. It's too dangerous.

replies.text: I'm way stronger than I look.

message: My family has used this place to grow mushrooms for five generations. Our mushrooms are famous from Feygard to Nor City, loved by gourmets and potion makers alike.
Last month, I went to Nor City to sell an excellent batch and decided to stay a little longer.
You see, my son is studying across the country to become a Shadow priest, and he is currently in the Valanyr temple of the Shadow. I had not seen him for so long, so I decided to visit him.
Anyway, when I came back here, I felt something strange had happened. I couldn't tell what, but I knew evil was around as soon as I touched the door knob.

replies.text: Dealing with evil is my favorite hobby.
I will never help a worshipper of the Shadow!

message: When I got to my mushroom cave, I was attacked by some sort of giant living mushroom. I've been sick since then, to the point where I'm afraid I won't live long. I've locked all access to my cave to prevent anyone from being hurt.

replies.text: You really look bad. How can I help?

message: I know this potion maker in Fallhaven. Could you go ask him for a cure?

replies.text: Sure. I'll go there right now.
You fool! I'm not here to run your errands!

message: Thank you! I'll be waiting for you. Be quick!
Have you got the cure?

replies.text: Not yet. The potion merchant needs some spore sample to prepare it.

message: I'm sorry to have dragged you into this, kid. Take this key. It will open the way to my mushroom cave. You will certainly find what you need.
Have you collected the spores already?

replies.text: Yes. I have them with me.

message: Please get them for me.
These spores would do. Please go and give them to Fallhaven's potion merchant.
Quick, I am dying! The potion maker is the only one who could help me!
I hope you have good news for me.

replies.text: Yes, I have got a potion for you.

message:
Finally!
[He pours down the liquid greedily]
Aaah. I feel much better. That was neat. You have my everlasting thanks, kid.

replies.text: I am glad I could help.
I'd prefer to have my 150 gold back.

message: No, no, no. The uplifting feeling of saving a life cannot be balanced with gold.
No.
Now that I am restored again, I should go back to work.
I really should.
I should...
What? ... Ah, yes - work.
Indeed. I can't concentrate.
There seems to be an evil force near us. Yes, that must be it.
I remember my father warned me about this kind of thing before passing away. But I was just a kid and I forgot his advice on how to deal with it.

replies.text: Don't worry. I deal with evil every day. Whatever lurks down there, I can handle it.
How can you forget something that important! I guess I have no choice but to go.
Stupid old man. You really think I'm here to clean up your own mess!

message: Very good. Please go into my caves and check if everything is right.

replies.text: You're getting on my nerves now.
No way! You've bored me more than enough!

message: Don't forget that there are hidden rooms. I gave you my necklace so that you can find them. Wear it down in the caves. Never take it off.

replies.text: I'm curious what I will find there.

message: There are hidden rooms. I'll give you my necklace so that you can find them. Wear it down in the caves. Never take it off.

replies.text: I'm curious what I will find there.

message: It took you a long time to get back here. What has happened down there?

replies.text: I met an old sorcerer named Zuul'khan in the cave.

message: Zuul'khan? Hmm, I think I have heard this name already.

replies.text: He told me that your family imprisoned him using an ancient petrifying spell.

message: A petrifying spell? But this has to be renewed every week.

replies.text: Exactly. Thanks to your laxity, Zuul'khan got free.

message: And why is this Zuul'khan still running around? What did you do the whole time down there? Go and finish your work!

replies.text: Do you actually do anything with your own hands?

message: So Zuul'khan is dead?

replies.text: I don't think so. He just disappeared into the ground.

message:
Disappeared! I hope he doesn't appear here next.
Well, as a reward for your efforts, please take this bag of mushrooms to the potion merchant in Fallhaven. I'm sure he'll prepare something good for you.
Anyway. The evil force is not gone, so you'll have to go down there again.
It has moved probably to another place. But that is someone else's problem.
Leave now. I need to rest.
Hi kid. Nice to meet you again.

replies.text: I've finally defeated Zuul'khan and his giant mushroom. You won't have to worry about them anymore.

message: Now what has happened down there?

replies.text: I met a sorcerer called Zuul'khan. He offered me something of value, so now I'll kill you.

message: [You hear a sudden sharp click.] What is this? Help!
The chains have wrapped around your arms. You can not move any more!

replies.text: Why have I touched these cursed chains!?

message: The chains seem to soften their grip.

replies.text: Oof, at last I can move again! I thought that this was the end.

message: Oh kid, you look like someone nice. I don't want you to be injured because of me. I urge you to leave!
Give me your hand! ... No don't! ... Give me ...
I'm hurt ... I'll hurt ... Never do! ... Help! ... Kill! ... your hand - pleease ...
No! Don't do me wrong!
Hahaha! AHAHAHAHA! I am free again!
Be nice, kid.
I am the Archmancer of the underground. Widely known as Master of the Fungi and Commander to anything that crawls.
I am the great Zuul'khan!
Great and strong, yes.
You are the first human I've seen in such a long time.
And I am the last human you will ever see.
You may have a last wish. What do you want?

replies.text: Tell me why you are here in Bogsten's caves?

message: Bogsten's cave? Oh how I hate that name!
It was the Bogstens who imprisoned me here, long years ago. With a petrifying spell. I did nothing evil to them, except ... Well, I did almost nothing evil to them.
More than a century ago, I found the way to command the crawling species of the underground and to bend the fungi to my will.
I chose this place to practice my arts and prepare an army of Fungi.
The Bogstens must have heard about my activities in the caves under their house and became suspicious.
Lotho Bogsten sneaked down here and caught me unawares.
I didn't expect petrifying. Who would use such a weak spell that has to be renewed every few weeks?
I could not move but I noticed everything that was happening around me. Lotho Bogsten visited me regularly and renewed the spell.
Finally, after long, long years, Lotho Bogsten must have died. Fortunately, his son is not so dutiful.
Indeed he had a son. But that lazybones didn't come as regularly as needed. The spell wore off, and I could move again.
AHAHAHAHA!
I see that you have their family necklace. So you must die now.

replies.text: I'll have to thank Bogsten: This sounds like a fun fight.
You shouldn't kill me. I could be of use.
Please. I will crawl before you. Don't hurt me.

message: Disgusting. Away with you!
Hmm. Maybe.
Did you make up your mind at last?
Go and kill Bogsten up there.
Kill Bogsten and bring me his staff as evidence.

replies.text: What would I gain from this?

message: Then our little conversation is over now.

replies.text: Hm, wait. Let me think again.
I wish we could talk a little more.

message: Ah. You are not as stupid as you look, kid.
I'll give you two things.
I'll spare your life.
And I'll provide you with a permanent immunity to the spore poison.

replies.text: Agreed. I'll go upstairs and finish Bogsten.

message: Do so.
Is Bogsten dead already?
Bogsten is dead. Finally.

replies.text: Yes. Now where is my reward?

message: Give me the staff first.

replies.text: No, I have changed my mind. I'll rather keep Bogsten's staff.

message: You won't betray me, you little fool!

replies.text: Who is betraying here? Where is my dearly earned reward!
Little in height - but strong! Attack!

message: Finally I got the staff back!
Zuul'khan towers over you and starts muttering strange words.
Done. You will never fear any of these fungi spores anymore.
Leave me now! I have to regain my practice of spells.
Don't disturb me! I am practicing dangerous spells.
You again! How did you get into here?

replies.text: I could ask you the same.

message: Do not disturb me. I have to concentrate in building my fungi army.

replies.text: By reading a book? Is reading a book the lazy way to create an army?

message: That did it. Silence now, or ...
You again!
Go away you annoying child! I must create the leader for my fungi army!
I grow weary of you.
You interrupt my spells that will make my fungi leader invincible! Ha Ha! So now you must die!

replies.text: Eh - no, I don't think so.

message: You again! How did you get into here?

replies.text: I could ask you the same.

message: May I finally practice my black magic in peace?

replies.text: No, not if I can help it. By the way - your book looks strange.

message: What do you mean?

replies.text: It is a cookbook. I see lots of delicious recipes.

message: Oh that. That's a good cover. I got the book from a 'friend'. In between there are recipes of a completely different kind.

replies.text: You mean these strange letters next to the recipe of the Delicious Mushroom Soup?

message: Be glad that you can't decipher these letters. They are dangerous.
It takes great power to tame these spells. My fungi leader grows in strength every day!

replies.text: At school I was good at spelling: A B C ...

message: I've had enough of your cheekiness now. These were your last words!
You shall not pass.

replies.text: [Lie] Your master has told me to go here. Out of my way now!

message: The black fog hisses and instantly vanishes.
You shall not pass.

replies.text: Your foul master is gone again...
I think I have seen you before...

message: The black fog hisses and instantly vanishes.
You shall not pass.

replies.text: Your foul master is once more gone...

message: The black fog hisses and instantly vanishes.
You shall not pass.
The black fog hisses and instantly vanishes.

replies.text: You could be a little more varied.

message: You shall not pass.

replies.text: Your master is dead forever now. Begone!
Why me? What have I done to deserve this?

message: The black fog hisses and instantly vanishes.
No. We were expecting you to say so. We were told not to leave.

replies.text: I need to know what's behind this, but obviously I can't get past that way. I had best try to find another way.

message: You can't examine the chest with the great mushroom on your heels.
On your final blow, the great mushroom explodes. Suddenly, the mushroom pieces spring back to life!
The room is quiet at last.
The giant mushroom is finally destroyed.
Thank you, thank you!
My name is Lediofa. I was travelling with my family to Vilegard. We wanted to visit my uncle.
We were attacked by robbers in the forest. I don't know what happened to my family. It was terrible.
I was dragged into this cave.
The only thing I saw was a figure clad in black who kept muttering mean sounding words.
Yes, it was him. I hope you're not one of his friends? Please no!

replies.text: Don't panic. I am $playername from Crossglen. Zuul'khan received his just punishment. He can't do anything to you anymore.

message: Oh, how relieved I am to hear that! Thank you again!
This black-clad man wanted to feed me to this awful big mushroom. He told me the mushroom still needed to grow much larger, and then it could help him invade the land.
I'm glad this nightmare is over now. Thanks to you, $playername.

replies.text: I do things like that every other day.
It was a tough fight indeed.

message: I should go look for my parents - I'm sure they are very worried. Although...
The boy told me he had some business with a rich man in Brimhaven. Maybe he went there.

I don't know. Maybe it was the deliverer of the letters.

[Oh no, it could have been Andor who destroyed the dam!]
You...what? After saving me, you would turn against me?
What do you intend to do with the mouse?

replies.text: I'll give it to the cat. That should solve the problem.

message: Here lies Hagale. Killed by greedy $playername, just when he wanted to start a new life.
This must be the great Duleian Road! I have heard so much of it - and now I am really here!
I should better wear my gloves again.

Here lie the members of the Bogsten family.
May they rest in peace.
Bogsten, my dear great-grandchild! After all these years you come to visit me again!

replies.text: Sorry, I am not of your family. I am $playername from Crossglen.

message: Really? My eyes don't seem to be as clear as they used to be.
Where is this naughty boy? He should have come for cleaning every week.

replies.text: I met him in the house upstairs. He was very ill.

message: Death is not a reason to neglect one's duties!
Ill? You mean lazy and sleepy!
I never could stand that spoiled kid. He only ever comes to get new gold from the family treasure.
Ungrateful indeed. I would rather give our gold to some random beggar than to see it squandered by him.
Tell me child, where are you going in the world?

replies.text: My father sent me to find my brother Andor. He left some time ago and hasn't come back yet.

message: It really is an honorable goal. I like you, my child. Truly.

replies.text: Did you see my brother? He looks a bit like me.

message: No, I haven't seen Andor. I hope that you will find him soon and that you can return to your father together.

replies.text: My father will be very glad.

message: How touching! I will give you something. You really deserve a little gold.
Go ye into our family tomb. You may pick something from our treasures.
It was a pleasure to meet you. Farewell, kid!
Ah, so you found your way downstairs. Smart child, it was a pleasure to meet you. Farewell!
So you've chosen my gardening gloves. A wise choice!
There used to be also a family-owned cookbook. Unfortunately that has been lost. It contained valuable recipes - the mushroom soup in particular was a dream!
Let's have another game - I bid.
Let's have another Skat game - Bogal, you bid.
Ah, good. I already thought you wanted to play Null.
Hey, you've forgotten 30!
Nonsense. I've been playing Skat for over 150 years now. I wouldn't make such a silly mistake.
Don't you dare play clubs!
I'm old enough to decide that on my own.  * giggle *
You already said 30.
I said FORTY, you deaf idiot!
Who's an idiot??
Both of you. Now go on, Bogal.

Why is this kid staring at us?
Hey, you! Never seen a Skat game?

replies.text: Sure. I'm a Skat pro myself.
No. My father always forbade me to gamble.

message: Oh dear. Go on, Bogal. I don't want to rot here.
Well, whoever would believe that ...
50 - still yes?? You must be cheating!
Cheating - me? Dare to say that again!
We all know that you always do. Calm down.
Oooh! If you were not already dead, you would be now!

replies.text: But gentlemen! It's just a game!

message: Just a game? Get out! Away with you!
OK. It's your game.
I must find it ...
Here lies Bogal Bogsten, youngest son of Boriel
Here lies Botisto Bogsten, middle son of Boriel
Here lies Bollo Bogsten, oldest son of Boriel
Here lies Boriel Bogsten
In death, I still help mushrooms to grow.
Here lies Febalum Bogsten, founder of this mushroom farm.
Bogsten is my name, mushrooms are my game.
Here lies Undina Bogsten, a master of fungiculture.
I've been planted in the soil, and it's dark. I feel like a mushroom.
You want to see the dead?
Now what's the magic word? Spell it!
That doesn't really make sense, don't you think?
The tombstone silently glides back into the wall.
Andor? Why would we have used the name of your brother here?
I used to love this too. But not anymore.
Ah - the answer to almost any question, yes. But not to this one - try again.
No.
No.

replies.text: Will you do it for me?

message: No.
You find some wild mushrooms!
You find some wild mushrooms!
You find some wild mushrooms!
Well, what did you expect? I make potions, not mushroom stew. If that's what you're after, go look for that Gison fellow south of town.
What a strange little place! You decide to record this in your father's book of achievements.

Stumbling across a group of people watching a beetle contest surely counts as one of the most unusual parts of your adventure. You decide to write some notes about this in your father's book of achievements.

Looking up at the old watchtower, you think back to the time you witnessed a falcon swooping through the air to catch its prey. You decide to write your memories about it in your father's book of achievements.

You think back over the number of falling rocks and crumbling floors you've encountered in these treacherous mountains. At least the place is safer for the next adventurer - you fell for every trap! You decide to write about your experiences in your father's book of achievements.
Yes. Nimael also makes very good soup. Vegetables with forest herbs. If I buy both I hope they will argue less about whose is better.
Yes, but it is not as good as mine.
Well, here is a small taste of mine, and a small taste of hers. I am sure you will agree with me.

replies.text: I think they are both good. One is not better than the other, just different. Different people have different tastes, so perhaps it is better that you offer both, rather than arguing over which is better?

message: For a kid, that's a very insightful comment. I will talk to my wife about how we can better sell both soups to the townsfolk in Fallhaven. Here are a couple of bottles of my soup as thanks.
Yes. Vegetables with forest herbs. It is even better than my husband's mushroom soup.
Well, here is a small taste of mine, and a small taste of his. I am sure you will agree with me.

replies.text: I think they are both good. One is not better than the other, just different. Different people have different tastes, so perhaps it is better that you offer both, rather than arguing over which is better?

message: For a kid, that's a very insightful comment. I will talk to my husband about how we can better sell both soups to the townsfolk in Fallhaven. Here are a couple of bottles of my soup as thanks.
No, sorry. I have not seen anyone that looks like you. We get few visitors out here in the woods.

replies.text: OK. Thanks anyway. Let's talk about something else.
OK. I need to be going.

message: You find an empty bottle.
It's nice to see you again. I have some exciting news to share.

Thanks to your advice, we have been successful selling more soup to the townsfolk in Fallhaven.
We have even cooperated to craft new recipies.
We also give free samples of our latest soups to those that buy from us, so they know what is on offer.

replies.text: I'm glad I could help. You sell more soup, and the people in Fallhaven get more choices. Everyone wins!

message: I have a variety of food and drinks.
I have some new soup now, from Gison and Nimael. It's expensive, but worth the money.
I feel a bit ill. Maybe I should rest a bit before I leave.

replies.text: That might be the giant mushroom's poison. The potioner in Fallhaven knows the cure.

message: [Lediofa's eyes widen.] I've been poisoned...? Oh no! I'll seek the potioner right away. Thank you for telling me. I hope we meet again, $playername.
I'm sorry that you're ill, girl, but I can't work for free. The price is 150 gold, no less.
You greedy swine...Oh! It's $playername! I came here to cure the mushroom poison, but that lousy merchant won't help me until he receives payment. And I have no gold...

replies.text: That's no trouble. I can spare 150 gold to help.
I'm sorry to hear that, but I can't spare the gold to help you right now.
The potioner is right, you know. Nobody works for free.

message: You've saved me again, $playername. You truly are a hero. If you ever find yourself in Nor City, I'm sure my family would love to meet you. Thank you!
But what can I do? I don't feel well...
Outrageous! I told you already, I don't have 150 gold!
One thing it likes is annoying children, like you. Thank you for volunteering!

replies.text: Sorry, I don't think so. I will destroy you and your fungi leader!
Sorry for disturbing you. I will leave immediately.

message: Oh, that's great news! I suppose I can get back to work with the mushrooms, then. Maybe tomorrow, after I've had time to rest.

replies.text: How can you be so lazy?

message: When you get to my age, maybe you'll understand that you don't need to rush through life. Now leave me to my rest.
Oh, it's you. Alaun still hasn't come by for his soup. It's a pity that you couldn't help him.
Ah, my hero returns. Thank you for the soup, it was incredible. What can I help you with today?

replies.text: Have you seen my brother Andor? He looks similar to me.

message:
You dare show your face in my home again? Out! Now!

[Alaun starts throwing things at you again]
Ah, my friend! Have you heard the great news? Gison and Nimael have started supplying the tavern here in Fallhaven with their newest soup. It's marvelous!
Oops, there was something sleeping inside.
